name: Texas Sage
climate: Texas Sage thrives in hot, arid climates, typical of southwestern deserts.
It prefers regions with warm temperatures and minimal frost occurrence.
This plant is well-suited for USDA hardiness zones 8 through 11.
Texas Sage can tolerate drought conditions but not excessive humidity.
sunlight: Full sunlight is essential for Texas Sage to bloom profusely and thrive.
It grows best in open areas where it receives direct sunlight all day.
Partial shade might reduce the blooming capability and foliage quality.
Ensure the plant is not overshadowed by other plants to maximize sun exposure.
watering: Water sparingly, allowing the soil to dry out completely between watering.
In its established state, Texas Sage only requires infrequent watering.
Overwatering can lead to root rot, a common issue with this plant.
During extreme droughts, slight additional watering may be necessary.
soil: Texas Sage prefers well-drained, sandy, or rocky soil for optimal growth.
It can tolerate poor soil conditions but dislikes overly rich substrates.
Ensure soil does not retain water, as it can cause root and stem issues.
Amending soil with gravel can improve drainage for the Texas Sage.
toxic: Texas Sage is non-toxic to humans and pets, making it a safe garden choice.
extra_care_tip: Prune regularly to maintain shape and encourage dense foliage and blooms.
